item.title: Report E-2025030481
item.description:
Report E-2025030481

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the driver attempted the unload product began leaking out where the external valve assembly is bolted on to the piping that leads to barrel. Roughly 6 oz's leaked on the ground before the driver was able to shut it down. He used spill pads to clean up the ground.

item.title: Report I-2025030062
item.description:
Report I-2025030062

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: MARYSVILLE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer signed off on paperwork and said 1000 gallons would fit. Driver filled tank and they came out to tell him he had a leak, he went indie to find approximately 75 gallons of overflow in containment. The tank was not being monitored during filling. Tank was inside the building.
